title: Widow celebrating last day of Iddah: Animal sacrifice Sheikhs reciting Quran Inviting people...assim
transcript: a Sheck in my country on the last day of either for a widow the family or the children will sacrifice cows kill cook a lot of meal share to visitors and neighbors and imams and she who come recite the Quran is this allow and can someone attend short a celebration and event in order for us to know whether this is allowed or not we have to go back in time to the time of the prophet and look at the end of the of a widow the four months and 10 days when it ended did she throw a a party like that did Imam come and recite the Quran where sacrifices offered did they feed the people and the answer is no this did not take place and therefore we know that such practices are part of Innovations especially that involves forms of worship such as sacrifice and reciting the Quran and inviting these so-called sh to read it if a woman comes out of her period and she feels after being in a room or in her house confined for four months and 10 days that she wants to celebrate of course she finished the morning period of 4 months and 10 days which is mandated by Allah but she wants to celebrate so she throws a gathering or a party to invite her friends and relatives to join her whom she would not see or would not visit during the past four and 10 months and 10 days there is no problem in that because this is part of the Customs but to relate forms of to it that would be an innovation
